alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Crawford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 20 at 12:50AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kansas, including the following counties, Cherokee and Crawford. * WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1250 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbus, Cherokee, Weir, Scammon, Roseland, Crestline, Lawton, Skidmore and Stippville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
